name: Python Packaging
author: The Carpentries Incubator
learningObjectives:
Identify the purpose and benefits of packaging Python code.
Describe the basic structure of a Python package (e.g., __init__.py, setup.py, pyproject.toml).
Recognize the role of metadata in package distribution.
List common tools used for packaging (e.g., setuptools, pip, build, twine).
Describe how to write and organize code for packaging.
Identify best practices for versioning and dependency management.
Recognize how to build and distribute a package to the Python Package Index (PyPI).
abstract: This lesson teaches how to create and publish packages in Python. We assume a basic understanding of Python, and assume learners are comfortable using simple commands in a Bash shell.
notes: Pre-alpha lesson. Uses Carpentries lesson template.
